title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The S&P 500 and Dow fell 0.2% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Nasdaq rose 0.4%. Each of the indexes ended February with a second straight monthly loss.

Target said it plans to spend as much as $300 million more this year on workers, which includes increasing pay and other benefits.

Lucid cut its 2022 vehicle-production target, underscoring challenges faced by the electric car maker.

Toyota said it would shut down all 14 of its factories in Japan on Tuesday after a supplier suffered a computer virus attack but that they would reopen Wednesday.

Toronto-Dominion struck a $13.4 billion deal to acquire First Horizon, a Tennessee-based bank.

Chevron is buying Renewable Energy Group for $3.15 billion, as the fossil-fuel giant faces investor pressure to invest in green energy.

Est√©e Lauder fired a senior executive who posted a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about Covid-19.

What's News: Business & Finance
